title: DIR/Floortime
shortDescription: Developmental relationship-based therapy focusing on emotional connections and child-led play.
description: DIR/Floortime (Developmental, Individual-Difference, Relationship-based model) is a therapeutic approach that focuses on building emotional connections through child-led play. Therapists and parents literally get down on the floor to engage with children at their level, following the child's lead while gently challenging them to climb the developmental ladder. This approach emphasizes the importance of relationships and emotional development as the foundation for all learning.
benefits: Follows child's natural interests and motivations
whoCanBenefit: Children who respond well to play-based approaches
Those needing support with emotional regulation
Families wanting to be actively involved in therapy
